title: Prostate Cancer Treatment Planning
description: A 67-year-old male with recently diagnosed prostate cancer requires a treatment plan.
history: Patient presents with elevated PSA (10.5 ng/mL). Biopsy confirmed adenocarcinoma of the prostate, Gleason score 7 (4+3).

imaging.description: CT scan shows a 2.3 cm lesion in the right lobe of the prostate with no evidence of extracapsular extension.
MRI confirms the lesion with no evidence of seminal vesicle invasion or lymph node involvement.

diagnosis: Stage IIB (T2b, N0, M0) prostate adenocarcinoma, Gleason 7 (4+3)

treatment_options.name: 3D Conformal Radiotherapy
treatment_options.description: Standard 3D conformal radiotherapy with a total dose of 74 Gy in 37 fractions.

treatment_options.name: IMRT
treatment_options.description: Intensity-modulated radiation therapy with a total dose of 78 Gy in 39 fractions.

treatment_options.name: VMAT
treatment_options.description: Volumetric modulated arc therapy with a total dose of 78 Gy in 39 fractions.

questions.text: Which treatment option would provide the best dose conformity while minimizing dose to the rectum?
questions.explanation: VMAT generally provides better dose conformity than 3D conformal RT and comparable or better organ-at-risk sparing compared to IMRT, with shorter treatment times.

questions.text: What immobilization technique is most appropriate for this patient?
questions.explanation: For prostate radiation therapy, knee and foot supports provide adequate immobilization while being comfortable for the patient during daily treatments.

follow_up: The patient completed the prescribed course of VMAT with good tolerance. PSA at 3 months post-treatment was 1.2 ng/mL, indicating good response to treatment.
